definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: Procrastination is the best way to bury your potential.
sentences.chinese: 推延是掩埋您庶獗能最佳的體例。

sentences.english: Put off Social Security as long as possible.
Wanting things to be perfect is just another excuse for putting off your dreams.
sentences.chinese: 凡事都追求完美，不過是無限期推延夢想的藉口罷了。

sentences.english: But the artist never showed up in court, so the hearing has been postponed. (See pictures of the fashions of Russian Czars.)
sentences.chinese: 但這位藝術家始終沒有到庭，聽證會已經被迫推延。

sentences.english: Dreams can be postponed, but NEVER give them up.
sentences.chinese: 夢想可能被推延，但決不能放棄。

definition: to push back (progress, the times etc)
to postpone/to keep putting sth off
(of time) to elapse or pass/(of a situation) to develop or evolve
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
to defer/to postpone/to put off/to retard/to slow sth down
to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
